intro: Trachyandra bulbosa, commonly known as the bulbous trachyandra, is a species of flowering plant in the family Asparagaceae. It is native to South Africa and is characterized by its compact, bulb-like structure that stores water and nutrients. The plant produces small, white or pale blue flowers arranged in a dense inflorescence. It thrives in well-drained, sandy soils and requires full sun to partial shade. Due to its unique morphology and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
